channel.title: NHC Eastern North Pacific
channel.description: Active tropical cyclones in the Eastern North Pacific

item.title: Eastern North Pacific Tropical Weather Outlook
item.description:
000
ABPZ20 KNHC 162316
TWOEP

Tropical Weather Outlook
NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL
500 PM PDT Sat Sep 16 2023

For the eastern North Pacific...east of 140 degrees west longitude:

Active Systems:
The National Hurricane Center has issued its last advisory on
Tropical Depression Twelve-E, which has moved into the central
Pacific Basin. Future advisories on Twelve-E will be issued by the
Central Pacific Hurricane Center.

Central East Pacific:
A broad area of low pressure located well south of the coast
of southern Mexico is producing disorganized showers and
thunderstorms. Environmental conditions are forecast to become
conducive for gradual development of this system, and a tropical
depression could form by the middle of next week. The system is
expected to move west-northwestward over the central and western
portions of the east Pacific during the next several days.
* Formation chance through 48 hours...low...near 0 percent.
* Formation chance through 7 days...medium...50 percent.

&&
Future information on Twelve-E can be found in Public Advisories
issued by the Central Pacific Hurricane Center beginning at 500 PM
HST, under AWIPS header HFOTCPCP4, WMO header WTPA34 PHFO. Products
will continue to be available on the web at hurricanes.gov

$$
Forecaster Brown
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: There are no tropical cyclones at this time.
item.description: No tropical cyclones as of Sun, 17 Sep 2023 01:34:59 GMT
